main event: A civilian observer and a naval member reported seeing a white dot moving about the lower limb of the moon.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on 12 August 1958 at 0635Z., The observation lasted from 0635Z to 0640Z., The sighting was drawn to the attention of the naval member by a civilian call., The object was described as a white dot., Multiple conclusions suggested the object could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: a white dot moving about the lower limb of the moon
witness description: a civilian observer and a naval member (BM3 Rusnak)
